title: Stephen Merchant to guest star in hit US comedy The Big Bang Theory
text:
Stephen Merchant to guest star in hit US comedy The Big Bang Theory Stephen Merchant to guest star in hit US comedy The Big Bang Theory 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Stephen Merchant, best known for his collaborations with Ricky Gervais, will guest in an upcoming episode of The Big Bang Theory. 
The US comedy, currently airing its ninth season on E4, is the show to be seen in judging from the impressive list of guest stars. The cast of The Big Bang Theory (Channel 4/CBS) 
Over the years, Professor Stephen Hawking, Billy Bob Thornton, Stand By Me’s Wil Wheaton, Stan Lee of Marvel Comics, Star Wars stars Carrie Fisher and James Earl Jones and the late Star Trek actor Leonard Nimoy have all made appearances. 
Hello Ladies star Stephen is reported to be playing a date for Amy (played by Mayim Bialik), the former girlfriend of Sheldon (Jim Parsons). 
Big Bang Theory showrunner Steve Molaro told the Hollywood Reporter of plans to keep the pair, christened “ShAmy” by fans, apart until the time feels right. 
“Right now, the dynamic has been fascinating and interesting,” he said. “We’re seeing all new colours for both of them as well as the way it impacts the group. There’s not a set plan — we’re feeling this out along in same way Amy is.” 
Lately seen in London’s Wyndham’s Theatre in The Mentalists, Stephen is busy producing cult hit Lip Sync Battle, now airing over here on Channel 5 and digital channel Spike. Share article 
In the hit show, celebrities face-off against each other with a lip sync performance to a popular song. It has been renewed by US cable channel Spike for a second season. Promoted Stories
